Package com.example.freeturilo.dialogs

Class FavouriteDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
        • com.example.freeturilo.dialogs.FavouriteDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddFavouriteDialog, EditFavouriteDialog
    public abstract class FavouriteDialog
extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
    A parent dialog for dialogs managing favourite locations.

    This is an abstract class. Object of a class that is child to this class is used to manage a favourite location through an AlertDialog. The dialog shows a view customized for favourite locations management. When its positive button is clicked, it should eventually call the positiveCallback.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:
    DialogFragment, AlertDialog

      • FavouriteDialog

        protected FavouriteDialog​(Favourite favourite,
                          @NonNull
                          Callback<Favourite> positiveCallback)
        Class constructor.

        Sets default values to titleResourceId, positiveTextResourceId and negativeTextResourceId.

        Parameters:
        favourite - a favourite location to be managed with this dialog
        positiveCallback - a callback which is called after this dialogs finishes with a positive button click

      • onPositiveButton

        private void onPositiveButton​(@NonNull
                              android.content.DialogInterface dialog)
        Called when the positive button is clicked.

        Validates input data of this dialog. If validation passes, the managed favourite is updated with input data, positiveCallback is called and this dialog is dismissed.

        Parameters:
        dialog - the shown dialog
        See Also:
        validate()

      • validate

        protected boolean validate()
        Validates input data of this dialog.

        If the name input is empty, a validation error occurs.

        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether validation has passed
